displayName.text: ITC Grand Chola, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Chennai

places.shortFormattedAddress: 63, Mount Rd, Little Mount, Guindy, Chennai

editorialSummary.text: Palatial choice offering elegant rooms & luxe suites with multiple dining options, plus shopping.

text.text:
Stayed @ ITC Grand Chola for 4N/5D during July 2025 while on a business trip to Chennai.

Impressed by the grand architecture, property amenities (600+ rooms, services apartments, many restaurants with specialised cuisine, swimming pool, spa, lounge, wellness centre / gym, etc.), sprawling lawns, spacious rooms, artisanal ice-cream place, fabelle chocolates store and courteous staff!
There were multiple specialty restaurants from Indian to Pan Asian, Indian, Italian, and more.

On all the 5 days, the breakfast buffet was a highlight-lavish, well-balanced with South/North Indian and Western options. The dinner spread, while decent, leaned more heavily on Indian options.

One suggestion: While items are clearly labelled with allergen info, I expected clearer separation between vegetarian and non-vegetarian items, especially for people with allergies. For instance, pancakes (with egg) and eggless waffles were placed side by side, with a shared serving tong - increases cross contamination risks. As someone with a severe egg allergy, this was very concerning for me. While the staff always prepared fresh waffles for me on request, the arrangement / layout of dishes didnt change over the 5 days I had breakfast - i expect better allergen awareness and caution from a luxury property.

Special mention to Sayantan @ front desk for a smooth experience, Susmita for her personal touch / calls about my experience, Abhisek who served us (during dinner on 7/10). Thanks team!

Overall, it was a memorable stay - but a bit more attention to detail and timely accommodation of guest requests would elevate the experience further!

text.text:
Room was comfortable and sufficiently spacious. The hotel has a Chola style architecture and sculptures on the inside - really good ambience. The hotel provided complimentary banana chips made in coconut oil which were really nice. Service was excellent. Swimming pool and gym facilities were well kept.
Was here for an office event. Food services were decent, beverages were really good.
Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

text.text:
My stay at ITC Grand Chola in Chennai was an exceptional experience, marked by luxury, comfort, and world-class hospitality. The rooms were truly opulent spacious, elegantly designed, and equipped with every modern amenity one could ask for. From the plush bedding to the high-tech in-room controls, every detail reflected attention to luxury and convenience. The blend of traditional South Indian architecture with contemporary touches made the space feel both grand and welcoming.

One of the absolute highlights of my stay was the food. Every meal was a culinary delight. The variety and richness of flavors across their multiple in-house restaurants were simply outstanding. Whether it was the lavish South Indian breakfast spread, authentic Chettinad cuisine, or the perfectly cooked international dishes, everything was fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. The service at the dining venues was equally impeccable warm, attentive, and knowledgeable staff who went out of their way to make sure we had the best experience.

The overall ambience of the property from the stunning lobby to the serene pool area and grand corridors exudes elegance. It’s clear that this hotel doesn’t just provide accommodation but a luxurious experience rooted in Indian hospitality.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure.

text.text: Been staying here couple times a year for the past 10 odd years. Love the hotel, we always stay in the North tower, rooms are nicely laid out. The breakfast offerings are exceptional.  Sadly  noticing a deterioration in staff responsiveness and demeanor. Perhaps the hotel is now too busy, the receptionist rarely connect or have a smile. The room furnishings especially towels are not fresh looking anymore and are also threadbare.

text.text:
ITC Grand Chola, Chennai

ITC Grand Chola is a true luxury property with a grand presence. While the rooms offered comfort, the ambience felt somewhat subdued due to the dark-colored furniture and décor, which made it a bit challenging to fully relax.

On the culinary front, the experience was truly exceptional. The dining options were remarkable, and we thoroughly enjoyed the flavorful, finger-licking dishes that ITC Hotels are renowned for. Overall, a memorable stay with standout dining experiences, though the room ambience could benefit from a lighter, more relaxing touch.

text.text: One of a few 7 star hotels in Chennai. Located near the sea, the ambience is quiet and relaxing. Maintenance is very good and as a customer we cannot ask for more. The staff need to be given some orientation and detailing of day-to-day activities so that customers are not left searching. Special instructions should be given to staff to address the questions of customers who look "simple" and are not "so informed". Food quality of South Indian dishes is ok. Needs  improvement to meet the standards of gourmets. :) Parking is plenty and the drivers are helpful.

text.text:
Me and my teenage  son I have been staying at The Leela Palace Chennai for the past week, his very first visit to India and it has truly been a special and unforgettable experience for both of us.
The warmth, professionalism, and thoughtful touches throughout our stay have far exceeded our expectations. We’ve been fortunate to stay at exceptional hotels across the globe, but The Leela Chennai has genuinely redefined what service and customer experience can be.This hotel sets the bar incredibly high. From the beautifully maintained spaces to the consistently kind and attentive staff, every detail reflects a deep commitment to excellence and hospitality.
Thank you for creating a place that feels so special. We will carry this experience with us for a long time.

text.text:
Do not stay here currently - there is very loud construction works going on. Their website discretely mentions this, though says the stop date is the 15th... It's the 17th, and the construction is ongoing. Came here with friends for a wedding.

We honestly would not have stayed here if we'd known it would be this ridiculously loud.

Every day, between 9am and 6pm. Even wearing noise cancelling headphones and with music on you can't get any rest.

They offered us the potential to move rooms, but on the day my partner was unwell and we were checking out the next day anyway. All our friends throughout the hotel had the same issue.

Not good enough for a 5 star hotel.

Other than this, the hotel is lovely. I imagine coming when there's not construction would be a great stay. The staff are wonderful.

text.text:
Taj used to be associated with luxury. Don't get me wrong, the service and the hospitality is still on point. The people are kind and helpful and get things done.

But wow the infrastructure and the hard product is so poor. The rooms are an afterthought. There's no harmony in the design. There's constant drilling sounds during the day. There's an ugly video door phone inside and very basic lighting controls which makes the whole place feel like a cheap budget hotel

Their Ginger hotels which are a budget hotel have some identity to their design. This is a mess.

Get back to the good days, Taj. Its not too late.

text.text:
Our stay at Taj Coromandel was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality that instantly made us feel at home. The staff are highly experienced, attentive, and always ready to go the extra mile to ensure every guest’s comfort. Their professionalism is matched by a genuine warmth that truly sets this hotel apart.

The dining experience was equally remarkable. The breakfast spread offered an impressive variety of dishes, each prepared with exceptional taste and quality. Whether it was authentic local flavors or international favorites, every item was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented.

Taj Coromandel doesn’t just provide accommodation—it delivers a complete experience of luxury, comfort, and care. I would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for world-class service and unforgettable memories.

text.text:
Elegant Property, Excellent Staff — But Buffet Dinner Was a Total Letdown

Stayed at Park Hyatt Chennai and while much of the experience was pleasant, there were a few key disappointments.

The staff was superb — warm, welcoming, and highly professional.

Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient.

Rooms are spacious and comfortable, but could definitely use better lighting, especially in the evenings.

Concierge and front desk took unusually long to respond to calls — phones kept ringing without an answer.

The biggest letdown: buffet dinner was shockingly poor for the price charged. The spread was very limited, especially for a luxury hotel. 0/5 for this — completely not worth the premium rate.

Additionally, they even charged for a 4-year-old child, which felt unreasonable.

Aside from the buffet disappointment, the property is well-maintained, and most services were on point. But for a hotel of this caliber, such a poor dinner spread was unexpected and dampened the experience.

text.text:
good hotel review should be descriptive and informative, painting a clear picture of the experience while also highlighting what makes the hotel unique. It should cover the location, amenities, rooms, service, and overall experience. Reviews should be concise, well-written, and provide details that would be helpful to other travelers.

Here's a more detailed breakdown of what to include in a hotel review:

1. Location and Accessibility:

Note the proximity to attractions, transportation hubs (like train stations or airports), and local amenities.

Mention the ease of getting around from the hotel.

If the hotel offers airport transfers, mention that as well.

2. Rooms and Amenities:

Describe the room's cleanliness, size, and overall comfort.

Mention the quality of the bed and bathroom.

Highlight any unique amenities like a great shower or comfortable bed.

If you have any specific room recommendations, such as staying above the ground floor for better privacy, share that.

3. Service and Staff:

Comment on the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.

Mention any particularly positive interactions with staff members.

If the hotel offers excellent service, be sure to mention that.

4. Food and Dining:

If the hotel has a restaurant, mention the quality of the food and whether it offers good value for money.

If the hotel offers a breakfast spread, mention the options available.

5. Overall Experience:

Provide an overall assessment of the hotel's value for money.

Mention whether you would recommend the hotel to others and if you would consider staying there again.

If the hotel offers a unique experience, make sure to highlight it.

6. Things to Consider:

Be honest and objective in your review.

Focus on the aspects of your stay that were particularly good or bad.

Provide constructive feedback that can help the hotel improve.

Be concise and to the point, while still being descriptive.

text.text: Rooms are well furnished at 5* level. Decor is classy and elegant. Food in the restaurants is great especially flying elephant  - though the omelette i was ordering for myself for breakfast, was inconsistent across the 3 days I had. Room service order on one night was incorrect- got a veg pad Thai instead of a prawn one. And when I mentioned it, there wasn't any reaction or apology which was weird. I think it lacks these finer aspects of service. I felt the room had a strong room freshener smell and I was personally unable to sleep well ( felt either too hot or too warm in the room). But will i come back, definitely yes - great value for what it offers among it's peers.

text.text:
I stayed at Taj Club House from 21st to 24th March 2025.  This was one of the best experience I had ever had in any of the hotels, I have visited so far.
Hospitality of the staff at the hotel was amazing.  Staff at the hotel did not say no to any of our requests.
They arranged for medicine for my daughter in the middle of night for my daughter.  And I am really grateful to them for that.
One day for breakfast we needed Jain Sambar and they quickly got that made for us and best part is that they remembered this request even the next day even when the hotel was completely booked.  I just had breakfast at the hotel and it was delicious and satisfying.
We were gifted a nice souvenir on check out.  Unfortunately, my daughter did not get the toy they generally give as a souvenir but they eventually were happy with the souvenir.

A shout out to all the staff members at the hotel. Sadly I do not remember name of all the staff members but Santhiya G, who had been very kind and helpful with checkout formalities.

text.text: I had a wonderful experience at Hilton Chennai. The staff were incredibly friendly, attentive, and always ready to help. The room was clean, spacious, and well-maintained, with all the amenities I needed for a comfortable stay. The location was perfect, close to Metro, making it easy to explore the area. The food at the restaurant was delicious, with a variety of options to choose from. Overall, it was a relaxing and memorable stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to coming back again.

text.text:
I’m a longtime fan of Hilton Hotels, and our stay at Hilton Chennai was truly memorable! Although our visit was a little while ago, I felt it deserved a review on a platform like Google because of the exceptional experience we had.

Highlights from our stay:

* The breakfast buffet at Vasco’s was absolutely superb! The food was delicious, and the ambiance of the restaurant was warm and inviting. A special thank you to Executive Chef Shibu for his hospitality and for making us feel so welcome.
* The rooms were spacious, incredibly comfortable, and always smelled fresh — such a lovely touch that made our stay even more enjoyable.
* We especially loved the outdoor terrace in the evenings. My husband and I would unwind there with some amazing mocktails and great music — it quickly became our favorite spot.
* The Front Desk team was fantastic and went out of their way to assist us during check-in, especially since we were traveling with my elderly father and had a few special requests. Their care and professionalism really stood out.
* Location is good though there are no restaurants or malls immediately outside the hotel

Hilton Chennai truly knows how to make guests feel special, thanks to a team that embodies the true spirit of hospitality — warm, courteous, and attentive.

Note: My review comes a bit after our stay, so some aspects may have changed since then — but the wonderful memories remain just as vivid!

text.text: "I had the pleasure of being served by GOURAB.during my stay at Hilton Chennai, and their service was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I entered the restaurant, they greeted me warmly and made me feel truly welcome. Every dish was served with attention to detail, and they patiently explained the menu, offering thoughtful recommendations that perfectly matched my taste. Their attentiveness was remarkable — topping up water without being asked, checking in just the right amount, and always wearing a genuine smile. It’s rare to find someone who blends professionalism with such warmth and passion for their work. He turned an ordinary meal into a memorable dining experience, and they are a true credit to the hotel."

editorialSummary.text: Warm rooms & suites in a refined hotel with pan-Asian dining, a 24/7 coffee shop & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
I stayed at the hotel recently and had a decent experience overall. The best part was the helpful and friendly staff. The front desk team, especially Adam and Aditya, were quick to respond and made sure everything went smoothly during my stay. Their service really stood out.

Room service was good, and the food I ordered came on time and tasted nice. The room itself was quiet, which helped me rest well, and the hotel’s location near the metro station made it easy to get around the city.

However, I felt that the room quality and the amenities didn’t match the price I paid. For the cost, I expected better features and a more comfortable setup. The room had the basic things, but it didn’t feel special or worth the high price. Small touches like better toiletries, improved decor, or extra facilities would have made a big difference.

In short, the hotel is in a good location with polite and responsive staff, but it could improve on room quality and amenities to make the stay feel more valuable for the money spent.

editorialSummary.text: Polished quarters in an upmarket hotel with restaurants & a nightclub, plus a spa & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
The Park Hotel Chennai is an excellent choice if you are visiting the city for a US visa appointment. Its most significant advantage is its location, it is just a short walk or a 2-minute drive from the US Consulate and the Visa Application Center, making it incredibly convenient for visa-related work. The proximity reduces travel stress on the day of the appointment. The highlight is hotel’s clean and comfortable rooms, supportive and prompt staff, and good amenities such as spa services, pool, and on-site dining. The property’s ambience is modern yet welcoming, and the staff are known to be helpful, which can be especially comforting during a possibly tense visa trip. If you’re traveling for visa appointments, then i would say it’s “worth every money spent.”

Overall, for those needing to visit the Consulate, The Park Chennai offers a hassle-free and comfortable experience, and its location is one of the best you will find for this purpose.

Our stay at the property was truly enjoyable and exceeded expectations. The hospitality and service were commendable, and we would like to extend our special thanks to Ms. Catherine and Ms. Sujitha at the reception for their warm welcome and consistent support throughout our stay. Their professionalism and attentiveness made a positive difference in our experience.

The only suggestion for improvement would be regarding the cleanliness and maintenance of the toilet area, as we noticed an occasional foul smell. Additionally, it would be helpful to place dry floor mats at the bathroom entrance to ensure better hygiene and safety. Implementing these small changes would further enhance the overall guest experience.

Excellent value for money and a must-visit for anyone who enjoys a wide variety of quality food in a classy setting. Will definitely come back!

text.text:
I recently stayed at Taj Wellington Mews in Chennai, and unfortunately, my experience was far below the expectations typically associated with the Taj brand.

From the moment of arrival, the service was underwhelming. Despite booking in advance, there was no greeting or assistance from the security or staff at the gates. I had to step out, open my car trunk, and hand over the luggage myself—something I've never had to do at any other Taj property. There was no welcome drink or gesture at the check-in counter either, which is usually a hallmark of Taj hospitality.

Upon reaching my room, I noticed the cookie jar—which has always been a small but appreciated touch in other Taj hotels—was missing. I then headed to the pool, only to find it disappointingly small in both length and width.

The breakfast experience the next morning continued the trend. The spread was quite limited compared to other Taj properties, and the counters were small and crowded. The restaurant staff seemed rushed and inattentive. Simple requests for items like Yakult, cashews, or juices were repeatedly forgotten, and I had to follow up multiple times. There was little sense of warmth or attentiveness from the staff, and it felt like they were just going through the motions.

Even during checkout, there was no enquiry about my stay or if I had any feedback. I was simply handed a small elephant souvenir. While a kind gesture in itself, it did little to make up for the service lapses. The departure process was frustrating—staff handled the luggage roughly and even opened the rear seats of my car without asking. They were trying to force all the bags into the trunk instead of checking with me first. I had to intervene, reattach the seats, and instruct them on how to arrange the luggage.

Overall, this stay was a letdown, especially considering my consistently positive experiences with other Taj hotels. The lack of warmth, coordination, and attention to detail was very surprising and disappointing.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Residences Tower, and I must say, I was thoroughly impressed! From the moment I walked in, everything felt modern, luxurious, and thoughtfully designed. The room was absolutely stunning — spacious, elegant, and equipped with all the comforts one could ask for. What truly stood out to me was the all-in-one control system via the iPad provided in the room. From adjusting the lighting and temperature to managing the curtains and entertainment options, everything was just a touch away. It added such a seamless and high-tech experience to my stay.

The cleanliness of both the room and the toilet was impeccable. Everything was spotless, fresh, and well-maintained, which made the stay even more comfortable and relaxing. It’s clear that the housekeeping team takes great pride in maintaining a high standard.

Overall, my experience at The Residences Tower was nothing short of exceptional. I absolutely loved every detail — from the smart technology to the cozy ambiance and cleanliness. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a blend of luxury, innovation, and comfort. Can’t wait to return!

text.text:
1.	Reception & Staff:
•	The reception team and hotel staff were extremely polite, professional, and courteous throughout our stay.
•	Their behavior and hospitality are highly appreciated.
2.	Stay Duration:
•	We stayed for one week as part of our official duty pattern, visiting frequently for work purposes.

3.	Room Condition (First & Second Floor):
•	Rooms provided on the first and second floors are in poor condition and urgently need renovation.
•	Carpets are old, stained, and have a strong smell.
•	Washrooms are leaking, and the flush systems are not working properly.
•	Showers are faulty and tend to fall off while in use.
•	Mirrors in the room are stained and unclear.
•	Visible dust accumulation in the nooks and corners of the rooms.
•	Overall, the room interiors are outdated and not suitable for a comfortable stay.

4.	Cleanliness & Maintenance:
•	The general condition suggests that renovation might be ongoing, but unfortunately, the rooms currently in use are not guest-ready.

5.	Food & Restaurant:
•	The food quality at the restaurant is good, and the overall dining experience is satisfactory.

6.	Travel Desk & Cab Service:
•	The travel desk staff are humble and supportive, but some cabs provided for airport transfers need better maintenance.

•	A few vehicles had poor air conditioning and unmaintained interiors.

•	Though not all cabs were in bad condition, there is no way for guests to know in advance which cab they will receive.

•	In urgent situations—especially airport pickups and drops—receiving a cab in such condition is inconvenient and needs immediate improvement.

*	7.	Overall Suggestion:

•	If renovation is in progress or rooms are not in good condition, it is a humble request not to accept guests in such rooms.

•	As business travelers, proper rest and comfort are essential, and the current room conditions made it difficult to rest well.

•	Accepting guests into non-maintained rooms affects their experience and performance, especially those staying for official duties.

*Final Note:
The staff is doing their best, but the infrastructure—both room and travel services—needs urgent attention. Once the renovation and service updates are done, the hotel will be able to deliver a much better and reliable experience for its guests.

I was surprised by the condition of this hotel, especially given that it’s a Marriott property. The hotel itself is quite large, with a massive circular lobby featuring plenty of couches and wing chairs for guests to relax in. Unfortunately, hygiene and upkeep leave much to be desired. This in turn doesn’t make it a comfortable stay
Pros
•	Conveniently located close to road and air transport
•	Friendly staff
•	Retains an old-world charm
•	Good breakfast spread
Cons
•	Soiled upholstery and carpets
•	Old, rusted bathroom fittings make the bathroom look unclean
•	the flush systems are not working properly
•	Shower don’t work properly
•	Dust and mold in the corners
•	Furniture with worn-off polish and chipped surfaces
•	Musty smell in the rooms
•	Dark, dimly lit corridors
•	Carpets with visible hand-sewn joints
•	Outdated interiors
When I spoke to the staff, they mentioned that a renovation is planned soon — something the property badly needs.

text.text:
I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. We had a long stay in this hotel and extended multiple times due to medical  reasons. We stayed in 4 different rooms in the third floor the floor/ rooms is infested with cockroaches, we found insects in the teabag and coffee drawer in one of the rooms.the manager was informed several times. They didn’t change the sheets often only when we requested although we had more than a ten day stay. Cleanliness should be the top priority for any property, but unfortunately this was severely lacking. The bedding and sofas had stains. Some of the staff in the kitchen area handled the bread with their own hand although there were tongs.
This hotel is supposed to be 5-star, but it doesn’t even come close to international standards.
Definitely not worth the money, I would not stay here again. The only reason we stayed because it was not easy to move with a patient and the bed mattress was good.

text.text:
We recently stayed at this hotel in Chennai, and our overall experience was quite pleasant with a few highs and lows. The room was simply superb — we originally booked a Superior Room but were pleasantly surprised when the hotel upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. This gesture definitely elevated our stay and gave us a great room experience.

The hotel staff were trendy and professional, but unfortunately, we didn’t feel properly welcomed on arrival. The front desk seemed too caught up in their work to give us the warm hospitality you’d expect from a 5-star property.

Despite being located in a busy part of Chennai, stepping into the hotel felt like entering a completely different atmosphere — calm, elegant, and peaceful.

We had opted for both breakfast and dinner buffet. The breakfast buffet was quite good, offering a decent spread. However, the dinner buffet was disappointing — the taste and variety did not live up to a 5-star standard and definitely needs improvement.

A special mention goes to the swimming pool — it was fantastic, very relaxing, and had thoughtful features that made it a highlight of our stay.

To sum it up: the room and overall hotel services were excellent, especially the complimentary upgrade and pool experience. The welcome experience and food quality, particularly dinner, were the downsides. With better attention to hospitality and culinary refinement, this hotel could truly deliver a top-tier experience.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Chennai, and it was a wonderful experience! The hotel has a modern and luxurious feel, with spacious, well-appointed rooms and comfortable beds. The staff were attentive and courteous, always willing to help with any requests.

The breakfast buffet offered a great variety of dishes, both Indian and continental, and the quality of the food was excellent. The swimming pool area is also lovely, providing a relaxing atmosphere in the heart of the city.

The location is perfect—close to the city’s main attractions and easily accessible from the airport. Whether you’re in Chennai for business or leisure, I’d definitely recommend Hyatt Regency Chennai for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

text.text:
An outstanding experience from start to finish at the Hyatt Regency Chennai!

The hotel is in a prime location — central, convenient, and easy to get around. The property itself is spacious, clean, and very well maintained, with a strong sense of safety and comfort throughout.

The rooms are large, spotless, and thoughtfully designed, making for a truly relaxing stay. The dining options are fantastic, with multiple restaurants offering a great variety of delicious cuisines. The bar area is a great highlight, with live performances and a vibrant yet classy atmosphere that adds to the overall experience.

I also made use of the spa and gym facilities, both of which are top-notch. The spa services were excellent, and the gym is well-equipped and clean — perfect for staying on track while traveling.

What truly sets this hotel apart is the team of people working here. Every single staff member I interacted with — from the general manager and front desk team, to the concierge, waitresses, housekeeping staff, security guards, chefs, and kitchen team — was courteous, professional, and genuinely warm. You can tell there is a real culture of hospitality here. Everyone made an effort to ensure guests feel welcome, comfortable, and well cared for.

A big thank you to everyone at the Hyatt Regency Chennai for making my stay so memorable. Highly recommended whether you’re here for business or leisure!

text.text:
I stayed in Green Park hotel in Chennai on July 17th and was assigned a room where I encountered a serious hygiene issue: cockroaches. Despite informing the front desk immediately, the response was minimal. Only one dead cockroach was removed and I was told everything was fine—but sightings continued throughout the day. I’ve documented this with photographs.
I emailed the hotel and attached the photos, expecting a timely response. Unfortunately, I received no reply or acknowledgment. This lack of follow-up only added to the frustration.

As a returning guest, I had expected much better. The casual response to a cleanliness concern was unacceptable, especially after spending a significant amount at the hotel’s in-house restaurant. This experience has deeply affected my trust in the property.

I hope the management takes feedback like this seriously and works to improve both hygiene standards and responsiveness.

text.text:
Our experience at Green Park Vadapalani was very good overall. The customer service was commendable, and the breakfast options were satisfying with a decent variety to choose from. We genuinely enjoyed our stay.

One highlight that truly stood out was the live flute player in the mornings—his music was absolutely beautiful. We made it a point to sit and watch him play every day. It gave us such a happy, peaceful start and really boosted our mood each morning.

The location is also a major plus. There’s a mall right beside the hotel, which made things super convenient, and there are temples and local shops all around, all within walking distance. It was very easy to get around without needing transport all the time.

One thing I do wish they considered, though, is showcasing more of the Indian culture. Many people visit places like this to experience that unique cultural touch, but none of the staff or servers reflected it. It would have been lovely to see them in traditional Indian attire—it would have added so much charm and authenticity, instead of sticking solely to Western norms.

text.text:
I stayed at Marriott Chennai for 5 nights (July 13–18) with my wife and child during our US visa appointments. We chose Marriott for a safe and hygienic stay, fully dependent on the hotel for all meals.

Unfortunately, both I and my son fell ill on separate days after eating at the buffet — I had stomach pain after a salad, and my son suffered vomiting and loose motions. The hotel management assured me that food samples had been sent for lab testing, but without any transparency or follow-up, I’m unsure how effective that really is. I was also given the usual standard assurances about Marriott following “the highest food safety protocols,” but our experience says otherwise.

I also noticed the hotel seemed understaffed, with ground-level staff working long hours. Being close to the US Consulate, I feel the hotel has become complacent, relying on constant short-stay guests.

I’m writing this review not just to share my personal experience, but to ensure there’s a public record. If others face similar issues, there will be a trail of repeated incidents for reference. I sincerely hope Marriott’s senior management or global leadership looks into such cases and takes serious corrective action.

Spending over ₹1 lakh for a five-day stay — only to fall ill and spend most of my time managing my and my son’s health — is not acceptable. Food safety and hygiene cannot be compromised, especially at a hotel of this reputation and price point.

Courtyard by Marriott in Chennai is a great choice for both business and leisure travelers. Located about 30 minutes from Chennai International Airport, it offers easy access without being too far from the city center.

The staff here are incredibly warm, courteous, and always ready to help, which really enhances the overall experience. The rooms are spacious, clean, and very comfortable—ideal for a relaxing stay after a long day.

One of the highlights is the gym—it's large, well-maintained, and fully equipped with everything you’d need for a solid workout. While it’s a bit disappointing that there’s no swimming pool, the hotel does offer good spa services to help you unwind.

Overall, a reliable and comfortable stay with excellent service and amenities. Would definitely recommend it for a short or extended visit to Chennai.

text.text: I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights. I was deeply disappointed. I am surprised that Marriott allows his hotel to be called four stars. The facility, especially the lobby and restaurant area is extremely old and not well maintained it. The service in the restaurant for breakfast is horrible. Extremely slow, tables are dirty, the best way to get anything is to literally walk up to somebody. During my say where a number of issues. At one point, the water was coming out of the faucet in the shower was brown. And dirty. The room itself was fine. Nothing to worry about, but decent and clean. Housekeeping is good. The executive lounge is bare minimum. The polish at this hotel just does not exist. Hallways and elevator are often dirty. Benches outside the elevator are covered in dust. Sometimes I have called the front desk and I am on hold for 15 minutes. The only reason I’m not giving it this hotel a one star, is because Tamana who works there was exceptional and did her best to rectify and enhance the experience. She’s a rockstar. She needs to be kept and valued to turn around this hotel. In the meantime, I would consider this a 2 or 3 star hotel. Not a 4.

Overall the experience was bad, because of the following:-
1. The room had a bad smell when we entered
2. The check in was delayed by 20 minutes even though we came 30 minutes after the check in time.
3. The room walls are like paper, you can hear a quiet conversation in the other room, you should hope your neighbours are decent. You can also hear the doors closing and opening everywhere.
4. The hotel is very far from the center of the city, peak hours can make it worse.

Some positives are:-
1. Staff are kind and helpful.
2. The free member breakfast is good.

text.text:
Stayed at Fairfield by Marriott OMR for 5 days and unfortunately, it was far from a satisfying experience. The biggest issue was the poorly designed washroom—water simply doesn’t drain, making the space unusable and uncomfortable. For a hotel under the Marriott brand, this level of construction flaw is unacceptable.

I requested a room upgrade, even offered to pay for a suite, but the team showed no willingness to help or even acknowledge the inconvenience caused. Disappointing hospitality and no resolution throughout the stay.

Expected better from a Marriott property. Definitely needs improvement in both infrastructure and guest service.

text.text:
The Leela Palace Chennai is an exceptional hotel that truly lives up to its name. From the moment you step into the grand lobby, you are transported into a world of luxury and sophistication. The hotel exudes a sense of royalty with its stunning architecture, regal furnishings and impeccable attention to detail.

The rooms at The Leela Palace Chennai are spacious and elegantly decorated, with stunning views of the sea or the city. Each room is equipped with modern amenities such as a flat-screen TV, luxurious bedding, and a well-appointed bathroom with high-end toiletries.

One of the standout features of this hotel is the exceptional service provided by the staff. The staff are warm, friendly and go above and beyond to ensure that your stay is comfortable and memorable. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone is dedicated to making your stay at The Leela Palace Chennai a truly unforgettable experience.

The hotel boasts several dining options that cater to different palates. The signature Indian restaurant, Jamavar, offers a culinary journey through India with its exquisite dishes. The Library Bar is perfect for an evening drink and offers an impressive selection of wines and spirits. The lobby lounge, with its high ceilings and stunning chandeliers, is the perfect spot for a cup of coffee or a quick snack.

The hotel also has an impressive array of facilities including a well-equipped fitness center, a beautiful outdoor pool, and a luxurious spa that offers a range of treatments.

The location of The Leela Palace Chennai is also worth mentioning. Situated by the sea, the hotel offers stunning views of the Bay of Bengal and is just a short distance away from some of the city's top attractions.

In summary, The Leela Palace Chennai is a modern palace hotel that offers a truly regal experience. From the stunning architecture and elegant decor to the exceptional service and world-class amenities, everything about this hotel is top-notch. If you are looking for a luxurious stay in Chennai, The Leela Palace is the perfect choice.

Luxurious Accommodations: One of the hallmarks of a 5-star hotel is the luxurious accommodations they offer. This can include spacious and well-appointed rooms, plush bedding, high-end furniture, and modern amenities.

Exceptional Service: Another key aspect of a 5-star hotel is the level of service provided to guests. Staff members at a 5-star hotel should be knowledgeable, attentive, and always willing to go above and beyond to meet guests' needs.

Fine Dining: 5-star hotels often boast exceptional dining options, including on-site restaurants that serve high-quality cuisine with an emphasis on presentation and taste.

Exclusive Amenities: Many 5-star hotels offer exclusive amenities such as spa services, fitness centers, and private pools to enhance the guest experience.

Attention to Detail: A hallmark of a 5-star hotel is a focus on even the smallest details, such as personalized greetings, turn-down service, and amenities such as fresh flowers and luxury toiletries.

Overall, a 5-star hotel is an exceptional destination for travelers seeking an indulgent, high-end experience. The best 5-star hotels combine luxurious accommodations with exceptional service, fine dining, exclusive amenities, and attention to detail, providing guests with an unforgettable and memorable stay.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the Taj Hotel a few months ago during my visit from Punjab, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience. The highlight of our stay was undoubtedly the exquisite food offered at the hotel. Every meal was a culinary delight, with a diverse range of dishes that catered to various tastes. From traditional Punjabi cuisine to international delicacies, the hotel's restaurant truly exceeded our expectations.

What made our stay even more enjoyable was the exceptional service provided by the hotel staff, particularly Jasmine. She went above and beyond to ensure that we had a comfortable and memorable stay. Her warm hospitality and willingness to assist with any request truly stood out. Jasmine's attention to detail and dedication to making our stay special left a lasting impression on us.

The hotel itself was a haven of luxury and elegance, with well-appointed rooms, stunning decor, and impeccable cleanliness. The attention to detail in every aspect of the hotel's design and maintenance was evident throughout our stay.

In summary, our experience at the Taj Hotel was nothing short of extraordinary. The combination of outstanding food, a luxurious environment, and the exceptional service of staff like Jasmine made our stay truly remarkable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area, and I look forward to returning in the future.

Review from my Dad (Yadwinder Singh)

text.text:
Exceptional Stay at Taj Club House, Chennai

I had the pleasure of staying at Taj Club House, Chennai, for two nights in January 2025, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, the warm hospitality and impeccable service stood out, reflecting the signature excellence of the Taj brand.

The rooms were spacious, well-maintained, and elegantly designed, providing a perfect blend of comfort and luxury. The bedding was plush, ensuring a restful sleep, and the amenities were top-notch. Housekeeping was prompt and meticulous, making sure everything was spotless and well-stocked.

The dining experience was exceptional, with a variety of delicious options. The breakfast spread was extensive, featuring both local South Indian delicacies and international favorites. The restaurant staff was attentive and accommodating, ensuring a delightful dining experience.

The location of the hotel is ideal, right in the heart of Chennai, making it convenient for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel’s facilities, including the rooftop pool and fitness center, added to the overall experience, providing relaxation and rejuvenation after a long day.

What truly sets Taj Club House apart is the unparalleled hospitality of the staff—always courteous, professional, and eager to go the extra mile to ensure a memorable stay.

Overall, my experience at Taj Club House was outstanding, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai. I look forward to staying here again in the future!

The rooms were spacious, well-maintained, and elegantly designed, providing a perfect blend of comfort and luxury. The bedding was plush, ensuring a restful sleep, and the amenities were top-notch. Housekeeping was prompt and meticulous, making sure everything was spotless and well-stocked.

The dining experience was exceptional, with a variety of delicious options. The breakfast spread was extensive, featuring both local South Indian delicacies and international favorites. The restaurant staff was attentive and accommodating, ensuring a delightful dining experience.

The location of the hotel is ideal, right in the heart of Chennai, making it convenient for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel’s facilities, including the rooftop pool and fitness center, added to the overall experience, providing relaxation and rejuvenation after a long day.

What truly sets Taj Club House apart is the unparalleled hospitality of the staff—always courteous, professional, and eager to go the extra mile to ensure a memorable stay.

Overall, my experience at Taj Club House was outstanding, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai. I look forward to staying here again in the future!

text.text:
Check in - 2/5
Rooms and Ambience - 5/5
Service staff, bell boys etc - 5/5
In room dining - 6/5
Overall 4/5

Beautiful 5 star hotel that oozes class. Nice rooftop restaurant and you can see planes landing.
In room dining kitchen was the best I have ever had. 5 stars is not enough

Sadly, check in staff was very poor.
We booked 3 rooms and I had requested for them to be connecting. I understand the hotel doesn't have connecting rooms but we couldn't even be put on the same floor.
I had a 11 month old baby and requested for a crib 3 ahead of time, and crib did not arrive till 1 hour after check in.
The worst of all is they placed the room with the baby on the 7th floor which is a smoking floor! There was clearly cigarette smells in the lift lobby and corridors

To the management, your check in staff was horrible to do that to a family with an infant. Please improve

Otherwise it was an impeccable stay.

text.text:
The Park Hotel Chennai is an exceptional destination that seamlessly merges luxurious comfort with unparalleled hospitality. As I stepped into the lobby, I was immediately captivated by the elegant ambiance and the warm greetings from the attentive staff, setting the tone for a remarkable stay.

The hotel's exquisite architecture and contemporary design offer a delightful fusion of modernity and sophistication. The rooms, adorned with tasteful decor and equipped with state-of-the-art amenities, provided a haven of relaxation. From the plush bedding to the stunning city views, every detail was meticulously crafted to ensure a luxurious and comfortable experience.

One of the highlights of my stay was the exceptional dining options available at The Park Hotel Chennai. The diverse culinary offerings cater to every palate, from exquisite local delicacies to international cuisines. The innovative presentation and delectable flavors at the hotel's restaurants left an indelible impression on my taste buds.

The Park Hotel Chennai also boasts impeccable service. The staff's attentiveness and professionalism were truly commendable, ensuring that every need and request was promptly addressed with a genuine smile. Their dedication to providing top-notch service further enhanced the overall experience, making me feel valued and welcomed throughout my stay.

Moreover, the hotel's amenities, including the well-equipped fitness center and the inviting swimming pool, added to the allure of this luxurious retreat, offering guests an opportunity to unwind and rejuvenate after a day of exploration in the vibrant city of Chennai.

In conclusion, The Park Hotel Chennai exceeded my expectations in every aspect. Its seamless blend of opulence, impeccable service, and attention to detail creates an unforgettable experience for guests seeking a luxurious stay in this bustling metropolis. Whether for business or leisure, this hotel stands out as a beacon of excellence in Chennai's hospitality landscape, making it a highly recommended choice for discerning travelers.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at ITC Welcome Chennai for five days with my husband and it was an exceptional experience.

Room:
The room was immaculate, spacious, and elegantly furnished. The bed was extremely comfortable, and housekeeping kept everything spotless and well-stocked.

Food:
The dining experience was a highlight. Chef Veeky's mutton rogan josh was a culinary delight. His spontaneity in creating delightful dishes added a unique touch to the dining experience.The variety and quality of food, from the breakfast/lunch/dinner buffet to in-house meals, were impressive, with chefs accommodating dietary preferences. The selection of halwas, kheer, and bakery items was extensive and delicious, adding a sweet touch to each meal.

Hospitality:
The hospitality was top-notch. From check-in to check-out, the staff were welcoming and courteous. Special thanks to Keith, Shankar, and Sudip in Marina Café for their attentive service, which greatly enhanced my dining experience.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at ITC Welcome Chennai for five days with my husband and it was an exceptional experience.

Room:
The room was immaculate, spacious, and elegantly furnished. The bed was extremely comfortable, and housekeeping kept everything spotless and well-stocked.

Food:
The dining experience was a highlight. Chef Veeky's mutton rogan josh was a culinary delight. His spontaneity in creating delightful dishes added a unique touch to the dining experience.The variety and quality of food, from the breakfast/lunch/dinner buffet to in-house meals, were impressive, with chefs accommodating dietary preferences. The selection of halwas, kheer, and bakery items was extensive and delicious, adding a sweet touch to each meal.

Hospitality:
The hospitality was top-notch. From check-in to check-out, the staff were welcoming and courteous. Special thanks to Keith, Shankar, and Sudip in Marina Café for their attentive service, which greatly enhanced my dining experience.

Overall, my stay at ITC Welcome Chennai was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure. Thank you to the entire team for making my stay so enjoyable. I look forward to returning soon.

highlightedText.text: "The hotel provided a truly memorable experience that was worth every penny."

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Radisson Blue Egmore Chennai for a four-day trip, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations from the moment I stepped into the premises, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The hotel's amenities were top-notch, providing everything I needed for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

The reception staffs, particularly Shibu the dining staff were incredibly friendly and efficient. They made the check-in process seamless and were always available to assist with any queries or requests I had throughout my stay. Their professionalism and dedication truly made a difference in my overall experience.

Now, let's talk about the food! The hotel boasted some of the best food I have ever tasted, rivaling even the finest 5-star standard restaurants. The variety and quality of the dishes were exceptional, catering to a range of culinary preferences. I was thoroughly impressed with the presentation, taste, and attention to detail in every meal I had.

The hotel staff baggage carrying staff, wallet parking staffs and cleaning staff including the reception staff and the ladies responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the rooms, were outstanding. The bed sheets and towels were of the highest quality, providing a luxurious and comfortable sleep experience. The cleaning staff ensured that my room was always spotless and well-maintained, creating a pleasant and hygienic environment.
The amenities, especially the swimming pool and gym, played a major role in maintaining fitness enthusiasm. With state-of-the-art equipment and a variety of exercise options, the gym provided a perfect space for individuals to work on their strength and endurance. The swimming pool, on the other hand, offered a refreshing and low-impact way to stay active and improve my health Additionally, the availability of these amenities made it convenient for people who wanted to incorporate exercise into their daily routines, ultimately contributing to their overall well-being.

Overall, my stay at Radisson Blue Egmore Chennai was nothing short of exceptional. The hotel provided a truly memorable experience that was worth every penny. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and enjoyable stay in Chennai.
Lastly, I would like to suggest that you ask guests upon arrival whether they would prefer smoking or non-smoking rooms according to their requirement.

text.text:
I recently attended a meeting at the Hyatt Regency Chennai and was thoroughly impressed by the experience. The ambience of the hotel is truly a blend of luxury and comfort, with a welcoming atmosphere that sets a perfect tone for both business and leisure.

The food outlets are a gastronome's delight, offering a variety of cuisines that cater to every palate. From the authentic Indian flavors at Spice Haat to the exquisite Italian dishes at Focaccia, and the vibrant Sichuan offerings at Stix, every outlet was a culinary adventure. The 24-hour dining option ensures that you can enjoy these delectable dishes at any time, which is a great convenience for busy travelers. The food served at the banquet was lite and completely satisfying with live counters.

Moreover, the hotel's commitment to providing an authentic hospitality experience is evident in every aspect, Whether you're here for a meeting or just to unwind, Hyatt Regency Chennai ensures a memorable Visit.

text.text:
The Westin Hotel Chennai, located in the heart of the bustling city, is a luxurious retreat that offers a haven of tranquility amidst the chaos. With its elegant architecture, impeccable service, and top-notch amenities, the hotel provides guests with an exquisite experience.

Upon entering the hotel, guests are greeted with warm smiles and a grand lobby that exudes elegance. The spacious and tastefully decorated rooms offer a perfect blend of comfort and style, providing a cozy and soothing environment for relaxation. The plush beds, luxurious linens, and well-appointed bathrooms ensure a comfortable stay.

The Westin Hotel Chennai boasts a wide range of dining options that cater to various tastes. From authentic Indian cuisine to international flavors, the hotel's restaurants offer a delightful culinary journey. The signature restaurant, Seasonal Tastes, presents an array of delectable dishes, while Kangan offers a fine dining experience with its meticulously crafted Indian delicacies. The stylish and sophisticated bar, Willows, serves a range of premium spirits and innovative cocktails, making it a perfect spot to unwind and socialize.

The hotel also offers an array of amenities to enhance the stay of its guests. The WestinWORKOUT Fitness Studio is equipped with state-of-the-art equipment, allowing guests to maintain their fitness routines while traveling. The Heavenly Spa by Westin provides a serene and rejuvenating experience with its range of wellness treatments. The outdoor pool offers a refreshing escape, where guests can relax and soak up the sun.

One of the standout features of The Westin Hotel Chennai is its exceptional service. The staff is known for their attentiveness and willingness to go above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction. From the moment of arrival until departure, every interaction with the hotel's staff is marked by professionalism and a genuine desire to create a memorable experience.

The hotel's location is also a noteworthy advantage. Situated in Velachery, it provides easy access to various shopping centers, entertainment venues, and business districts, making it an ideal choice for both leisure and business travelers.

In conclusion, The Westin Hotel Chennai offers a luxurious and pampering experience to its guests. From its stylish rooms and delectable dining options to its top-notch amenities and outstanding service, every aspect of the hotel is designed to create a memorable stay. Whether visiting for business or pleasure, The Westin Hotel Chennai is a destination that promises a combination of comfort, convenience, and indulgence.

text.text:
My family and I stayed at this property for my birthday this year and they made it an exceptionally special affair. They not only decorated the room with an improvised bunch of flowers and leaves and balloons; they also have the tastiest desserts I've ever had at a luxury hotel in chennai. The food spread at the restaurant too is simply the most scrumptious; I would highly recommend the buffet - because the experience of dining on the exquisite spread, with the friendly staff always ready to help, is quite amazing. Westin carries very positive energies.

This property is about an hour away fr the airport, but it is completely worth the experience. The rooms are very spacious, well designed and have a great view of the chennai city scape, mixed with their suave looking pool area. Getting here is not too difficult and Westin is located near one of chennai's biggest malls - the phoenix market City.

A special note to the breakfast chef; she was exceptionally sweet, and left me with a box of goodies to take home with me during checkout. It was so very unexpected to be treated as if I'm leaving from home.

Not only are the staff friendly, they are genuine people who listen and pay attention to your specific needs. If you'd ever stay at Westin, rest assured it'll be nothing short of a extravagant on all fronts - food, comfort, kindness, relaxation and rejuvenation. The spa too is a highly recommended experience, and it's better if you have a membership at Westin so you get to avail a host of services at competitive prices.

I will always remember this birthday. Thanks to the Westin Velachery team for making it incredibly special.
